body:
I have actually the same issue, tried out all different formats and none of them is working. I have exactly the same log as above. only bug for Dataset, i tried to import label and it worked.

- OS: macOS Darwin 19.6.0
- installed doccano on May 10th 2020
- Using directly docker-compose, modifying the docker-compose.dev.yml for testing purpose

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

body:
It seems to me that the task queue is not running.
I updated the documentation. Please try it:

- [Running a task queue](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/docs/getting-started.md#python)

Thanks. But it seems not work for me.
I open another terminal and type:
```
cd doccano
pipenv shell
cd backend
celery --app=app worker --loglevel=INFO --concurrency=1

```

The issue can not be solved.

The log of celery's terminal is here: 

```
 -------------- celery@123 v5.0.5 (singularity)
--- ***** -----
-- ******* ---- Windows-10-10.0.19042-SP0 2021-05-11 09:50:07
- *** --- * ---
- ** ---------- [config]
- ** ---------- .> app:         app:0x1925f3718b0
- ** ---------- .> transport:   sqla+sqlite:///C:\Users\123\Desktop\doccano\backend\db.sqlite3
- ** ---------- .> results:
- *** --- * --- .> concurrency: 1 (prefork)
-- ******* ---- .> task events: OFF (enable -E to monitor tasks in this worker)
--- ***** -----
 -------------- [queues]
                .> celery           exchange=celery(direct) key=celery


[tasks]
  . api.tasks.export_dataset
  . api.tasks.injest_data

[2021-05-11 09:50:07,441: INFO/MainProcess] Connected to sqla+sqlite:///C:\Users\123\Desktop\doccano\backend\db.sqlite3
[2021-05-11 09:50:07,480: WARNING/MainProcess] c:\users\123\.virtualenvs\doccano-cckiaavz\lib\site-packages\celery\fixups\django.py:203: UserWarning: Using settings.DEBUG leads to a memory
            leak, never use this setting in production environments!
  warnings.warn('''Using settings.DEBUG leads to a memory

[2021-05-11 09:50:07,480: INFO/MainProcess] celery@D123 ready.
[2021-05-11 09:50:07,561: INFO/MainProcess] Received task: api.tasks.injest_data[eb866747-289f-4fb6-ab2f-11d277a96fbf]  
[2021-05-11 09:50:07,603: INFO/MainProcess] Received task: api.tasks.injest_data[93bc6c80-1721-4cce-a0d6-68b4c4938aa7]  
[2021-05-11 09:50:07,988: INFO/SpawnPoolWorker-1] child process 7076 calling self.run()
```

Hmm, this may be related to Windows:

- https://github.com/celery/celery/issues/4081

Unfortunately, I don't have a windows PC.
That's fine, I can use it through docker~

Have the same issue, started after uploading and ingesting a large file of about >240MB which took forever and now small file injestion of <1MB take the same time it feels.

and this is on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS and not on Windows

issue.title: Celery: Watchmedo command not found

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Running Doccano via docker-compose (`docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml --env-file ./config/.env.example up`), I can connect to the frontend, login and begin to create a task. However when I click "ingest" when uploading a dataset, I get a permanent spinning icon as in #1353. Looking at the logs from docker-compose, Celery exited, which may have caused the silent failure on data ingestion

```bash
doccano-celery-1    | Starting celery
doccano-celery-1    | /src/tools/dev-celery.sh: line 11: watchmedo: command not found
doccano-celery-1 exited with code 127
```


Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Windows
*   Python Version Used: 3.9
*   When you install doccano:
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Docker-compose

body: I've got the same problem on MacOS - why did you close the issue if it's not fixed!!!?

Same problem on Windows 10, Python 3.9, doccano 1.8.
Tried multiple data formats in different sizes (only a few lines up to a hundred) but the spinner keeps on spinning.
Is there maybe a workaround, where I can manually place the data in the DB or in some folder so doccano recognises it from the start without explicit import?

Make sure "doccano task" command is running in another terminal from the one you used to run doccano

> Same problem on Windows 10, Python 3.9, doccano 1.8. Tried multiple data formats in different sizes (only a few lines up to a hundred) but the spinner keeps on spinning. Is there maybe a workaround, where I can manually place the data in the DB or in some folder so doccano recognises it from the start without explicit import?

same problem
Python 3.10.5 (main, Jul 18 2022, 14:30:54) [GCC 11.3.0] on linux

Linux 5.15.52-gentoo x86_64 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-1165G7
run "doccano task" in another terminal and the problem got fixed thanks to @RalphChobok

(doc) C:\Users\65361>doccano task
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\65361\Anaconda3\envs\doc\lib\runpy.py", line 197, in _run_module_as_main
    return _run_code(code, main_globals, None,
  File "C:\Users\65361\Anaconda3\envs\doc\lib\runpy.py", line 87, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "C:\Users\65361\Anaconda3\envs\doc\Scripts\doccano.exe\__main__.py", line 7, in <module>

    env.read_env(args.env_file, recurse=False, override=True)

    raise ValueError("path must be a filename, not a directory.")
ValueError: path must be a filename, not a directory.

Facing above issue, not able to run doccano task 
envi is python - 3.9 and doccano is 1.8.1

> (doc) C:\Users\65361>doccano task Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\65361\Anaconda3\envs\doc\lib\runpy.py", line 197, in _run_module_as_main return _run_code(code, main_globals, None, File "C:\Users\65361\Anaconda3\envs\doc\lib\runpy.py", line 87, in _run_code exec(code, run_globals) File "C:\Users\65361\Anaconda3\envs\doc\Scripts\doccano.exe__main__.py", line 7, in File "C:\Users\65361\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python39\site-packages\backend\cli.py", line 174, in main env.read_env(args.env_file, recurse=False, override=True) File "C:\Users\65361\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python39\site-packages\environs__init__.py", line 409, in read_env raise ValueError("path must be a filename, not a directory.") ValueError: path must be a filename, not a directory.
> 
> Facing above issue, not able to run doccano task envi is python - 3.9 and doccano is 1.8.1

Run "doccano task" command in CMD not conda prompt
